official_title: A bill to authorize certain appropriations to the Office of Personnel Management, the Merit Systems Protection Board, the Special Counsel of the Merit Systems Protection Board, and the Federal Labor Relations Authority.

summary.text: Civil Service Authorization Act of 1981 - Authorizes specified appropriations for fiscal years 1982 and 1983 to the Office of Personnel Management, the Merit Systems Protection Board (MSPB), the Special Counsel of the MSPB, and the Federal Labor Relations Authority for salaries and expenses. Authorizes the appropriation to such agencies of such additional sums as necessary for increased expenses resulting from: (1) statutorily mandated pay raises; (2) payments to the General Services Administration for increased charges for space and services; and (3) increases in postal rates. Requires appropriations to such bodies to be considered authorized only to the extent expressly provided by statute. Declares that expenses incurred by MSPB in the administration of appeals of agency actions concerning civil service retirement shall be paid from the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund.
